intro: Conyza moluccana, commonly known as the Moluccan ironweed, is an annual herbaceous plant native to tropical and subtropical regions of Asia, Africa, and the Pacific Islands. It typically grows to a height of 30–100 cm, featuring hairy stems and opposite, lance-shaped leaves. The plant produces small, yellow flowers arranged in composite inflorescences, which are characteristic of the Asteraceae family. It thrives in disturbed soils and is often found in open habitats such as roadsides and fields. Conyza moluccana is also known for its potential medicinal properties and has been used in traditional herbal remedies.
